Name: attrelid
Description: The table this column belongs to

Name: attname
Description: The column name

Name: atttypid
Description: The data type of this column

Name: attstattarget
Description: attstattarget controls the level\nof detail of statistics accumulated for this column by ANALYZE. A zero value indicates that no statistics should be collected. A negative value says to use the system default statistics target. The exact meaning of positive values is data type-dependent. For scalar data types, attstattarget is both the target number of "most common values" to collect, and the target number of histogram bins to create.

Name: attlen
Description: A copy of pg_type.typlen of this\ncolumn's type

Name: attnum
Description: The number of the column. Ordinary columns are numbered from 1\nup. System columns, such as oid, have (arbitrary) negative numbers.

Name: attndims
Description: Number of dimensions, if the column is an array type; otherwise\n0. (Presently, the number of dimensions of an array is not enforced, so any nonzero value effectively means "it's an array".)

Name: attcacheoff
Description: Always -1 in storage, but when loaded into a row descriptor in\nmemory this might be updated to cache the offset of the attribute within the row

Name: atttypmod
Description: atttypmod records type-specific\ndata supplied at table creation time (for example, the maximum length of a varchar column). It is passed to type-specific input functions and length coercion functions. The value will generally be -1 for types that do not need atttypmod.

Name: attbyval
Description: A copy of pg_type.typbyval of this\ncolumn's type

Name: attstorage
Description: Normally a copy of pg_type.typstorage\nof this column's type. For TOAST-able data types, this can be altered after column creation to control storage policy.

Name: attalign
Description: A copy of pg_type.typalign of this\ncolumn's type

Name: attnotnull
Description: This represents a not-null constraint. It is possible to change\nthis column to enable or disable the constraint.

Name: atthasdef
Description: This column has a default value, in which case there will be a\ncorresponding entry in the pg_attrdef catalog that actually defines the value.

Name: attisdropped
Description: This column has been dropped and is no longer valid. A dropped\ncolumn is still physically present in the table, but is ignored by the parser and so cannot be accessed via SQL.

Name: attislocal
Description: This column is defined locally in the relation. Note that a\ncolumn can be locally defined and inherited simultaneously.

Name: attinhcount
Description: The number of direct ancestors this column has. A column with a\nnonzero number of ancestors cannot be dropped nor renamed.

Name: attcollation
Description: The defined collation of the column, or zero if the column is\nnot of a collatable data type.

Name: attacl
Description: Column-level access privileges, if any have been granted\nspecifically on this column

Name: attoptions
Description: Attribute-level options, as "keyword=value" strings

Name: attfdwoptions
Description: Attribute-level foreign data wrapper options, as "keyword=value" strings
